name: Senior DevOps Engineer
description:
Parallels Remote Application Server is a virtual application and desktop delivery solution allowing access and use applications and data from any device. From an engineering perspective it's a technically challenging and interesting project, involving many programming languages, distributed across several operating systems and platforms, working on-prem or in the cloud.

If you’re ambitious and thrive on working with the world’s big companies to solve tough problems together with a smart, motivated team, you would want to work here.

Key skills::

  • Linux (Ubuntu, CoreOS, CentOS)
  • Git
  • .NET/Java/golang/Python/Bash
  • Terraform, Ansible
  • PostgreSql/MongoDB/Redis
  • Nginx/HAProxy
  • GitLabCI
  • Docker, Kubernetes
  • RabbitMQ
  • EFK
  • Grafana, Prometheus
  • Jenkins

Responsibilities:

  • Design, develop, and build highly available infrastructure and software in large distributed and Hybrid Cloud environments
  • Working with the development teams to clarify runtime infrastructure requirements
  • Review architectural designs for managed systems
  • Provide in-depth analysis for improving the deployment of cloud-native applications, monitoring, log management, securing, and supporting a Kubernetes cluster
  • As the subject matter expert, you will lead efforts in deep-dive troubleshooting issues related to a Kubernetes environment
  • Lead and drive the root cause analysis (RCA) process while recommending then implementing long-term fixes
  • Understanding performance and security considerations for the code we deploy
  • Build automation frameworks and systems to improve time to delivery through the use of modern CI/CD systems
  • Perform and improve SRE / operational functions, such as monitoring and maintenance of productions systems

Requirements:

  • Strong experience with Linux and Windows operating systems
  • Experience with installing, configuring and troubleshooting Kubernetes (Calico/Flannel, istio, etcd, Ingress controller nginx, coredns).
  • Understanding of CI/CD and experience to configure the full cycle to production.
  • Experience working with database systems, network topologies, and hardware
  • Understanding "Secure by Design" and other security principles in software development
  • Experience with Monitoring and reporting tools such as DataDog, New Relic, Nagios, and Graphite
  • Experience with Configuration Management tools
  • Experience with managed Kubernetes in the cloud
  • Hands-on system administrator experience on public cloud platforms, at least one of the big three (Google Cloud, AWS, and Azure)

Benefits

  • Competitive salary
  • Learn new technologies and platforms, participating on conferences
  • Flexible work schedule, ability to work remotely
  • Occasional business trips to Maltese office
  • Friendly team of experienced multinational professionals
  • Medical and dental insurance
  • Gym discount
